Yuzu Curd Tart

Courses: Dessert
Categories: Tart
Collections: kitchen all
Source:
Serving size: 32
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

Pastry

900g Plain flour

600g chilled butter, unsalted

300g icing sugar

2 zest of lemon

1.5 tsp vanilla paste

3 whole eggs

1/2 tsp salt

4.5 tbls toasted black sesame seeds

Curd

500ml Shiso infused yuzu juice

10 zest of lemon

600ml thickened cream

780g sugar

18 whole eggs, room temp.

4 egg yolk, room temp.

Directions

Pastry

Combine dry ingredients with chilled diced butter and rub butter with fingertips until it resembles bread crumbs.

Add wet ingredients and mix with your hands and knead the paste slightly on a lightly floured bench until combined.

Divide into 4 (x1 recipe) equal fattened balls and clingfilm individually. Refrigerate until solid (60 min) or quickly freeze until hard.

Rest paste for 5 mins so it’s more malleable but still firm. Grease flan tins with spray oil & lightly dust with flour.

Beat dough with a rolling pin to slightly flatten, evenly. Rollout to an even 0.5cm thickness to shape paste into flan tin, pushing into the bottom edge and wall of the tin. Keep paste at an even thickness and chill for 30 mins.

Smart preheat the PRO combi oven to 180c. Roll the rolling pin across the top to remove the overhanging paste and freeze for reuse. Poke small holes into the base and place in cartouches, then fill them with the baking rice.

Bake on flat trays for 12 mins until the top edges are golden, then remove cartouches and reserve for reuse. Bake for a further 2 mins until the base has dried out and then brush tarts heavily with a whisked egg white/salt mix. Bake for 7-8 mins, until well golden all over.

Remove trays from the oven and use the pizza spatula to carefully remove tart shells from the tins onto wire racks. Cool at room temp until cold and wrap individually in clingfilm. Freeze on the tray rack.

Curd

Place all the curd ingredients into a pot. Whisk lightly until mostly combined, do not introduce air into the mix. Preheat the combi oven to 120c and retrieve frozen shells. Only use the induction stove on 800 to warm the curd slowly, or use a double boiler on gas. Use a spatula to constantly stir while using a probe, slowly bringing the temperature of the mixture to 65c.

Meanwhile place frozen tart shells into the oven for 5-10 mins, on wire racks.

Quickly transfer the warmed curd to a jug using a sieve to strain out the zest and ladle out the white foam that forms when curd is not constantly stirred. Turn the oven down to 75c and carefully pour the curd into the shells inside the oven. Use a gas torch to pop any bubbles.

Cook for approx. 40 mins, until there's a firm jigal. Cool on wire racks at room temp. Once completely cool, slice using a knife larger than the tart and wipe the knife clean after each cut. Slice in half until you have 8 slices. Store in a sealed container inside the cool room.

Notes

Recipe x1 makes 32 slices (4 tarts), if only making curd for 2 tarts halve the recipe to 16 (x0.5).

Only use chilled butter and fingertips for the pastry to stop the gluten from stretching.

If tart shells are visibly broken, DO NOT use them. The Curd is more expensive.

Lemons need to be zested finely, to have no pith at all, as it will make the curd too bitter.

Photos

Yuzu miso emulsion for Imperador carpaccio

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source:
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

170g Shiro miso

225ml rice wine vinegar

225ml yuzu juice

75ml mirin

45g castor sugar

450ml oil

12g (1 tbsp) salt

For the chive oil

200g chive

400g oil

5g salt

Directions

Add all ingredients together into a jug apart from the oil, slowly pour in the oil while emulsifying with the stick blender.

For the chive oil

Blanch the chives in boiling water for 10 seconds then refresh in ice water. Drain and squeeze out excess water. Roughly chop so the chives don’t get stuck on the blade of the blender. Blend all together in liquidiser. Cryovac and hang so the solids fall to the bottom corner of the bag for easy removal.

Zenzai azuki bean soup

Courses:
Categories:
Collections:
Source:
Serving size:
Preparation time:
Cooking time:

Ingredients

300g azuki beans

1440g water

225g sugar

2 orange julienne zest

1 pinch salt

1 cinnamon stick

Juice from 1 orange to taste

Directions

Soak beans in water overnight and then drain and rinse before cooking.

Add beans and water to a pot, bring to the boil and simmer without a lid for 1hr or until the beans are soft and mash in your fingers easily.

Add sugar, orange zest and cinnamon stick continue to cook for 10 mins and let it steep as it cools.

Add orange juice to taste

Remove the cinnamon and drain the liquid from the beans and store separately.

Photos
